title: Investors Sorting Through Coronavirus, Civil Unrest, and More Stimulus
text:
The stock market continues to respond to the concerns of increasing numbers of COVID-19 outbreaks versus positive economic news, reports on developing treatments for the virus, and the prospects for more monetary and fiscal stimulus. Signs that the economic recovery has begun were seen in the May jobs numbers that reported a gain of just […]
The post Investors Sorting Through Coronavirus, Civil Unrest, and More Stimulus appeared first on See It Market.

title: The economic recovery is, 'as good as you could have hoped for,': Strategist
text: Charles Schwab Chief Global Investment Strategist Jeffrey Kleintop joins Yahoo Finance’s Akiko Fujita to discuss his outlook on the markets, as stocks see modest gains amid an uptick in coronavirus cases.

title: White House trade advisor Peter Navarro denies saying that China trade deal is 'over'
text: "My comments have been taken wildly out of context," Navarro said in a statement from the White House after the Fox News reported that he said the U.S.-China trade deal was "over.

title: Trump Says China Trade Deal 'Fully Intact' After Mixed Messages From Navarro
text: Appearing on Fox News on Monday evening, White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said the trade deal with China was off due to the origins of the ongoing coronavirus pandemic.

title: The economy will 'grow more slowly,'  if we can't stop the spread of COVID-19: Boston Fed
text: Yahoo Finance’s Brian Cheung sat down with Boston Fed President Eric Rosengren to address restoring the economy, the future of forward guidance and how the Fed will manage near-zero rates post-pandemic.

title: Oil prices seesaw after Navarro walks back comment saying U.S.-China trade deal was 'over'
text: Oil prices were volatile on Tuesday after markets were spooked by surprise comments from White House trade adviser Peter Navarro saying a hard-won U.S-China trade deal was "over", though he later said his comments had been taken out of context.

title: White House adviser Navarro says China trade deal is 'over'
text: White House trade adviser Peter Navarro said on Monday the trade deal with China is "over," and he linked the breakdown in part to Washington's anger over Beijing's not sounding the alarm earlier about the coronavirus outbreak.

title: Better or Worse? The Road to Recovery Starts With Things Getting Less Bad

title: NYSE seeks SEC approval for more direct listings
text: The New York Stock Exchange filed an amendment today with the Securities and Exchange Commission to allow for more direct listings. Direct listings offer a more streamlined method for companies to go public and raise capital than traditional IPOs — which entail a lengthy roadshow process and involvement of underwriters to determine valuations and share-prices.

title: Nasdaq struggles to hold onto close near record territory as Trump set to sign order suspending new work visas
text: U.S. stocks Monday afternoon slipped off their highs of the session and the technology-laden Nasdaq Composite drifted around a new closing record, after reports signaled that President Donald Trump was on the cusp of signing an executive order that could limit workers applying for a wide array of jobs in the U.S. The Dow Jones Industrial Average  was trading up 0.4% at 25,958 but had been near an intraday peak at 26,059.81, while the S&P 500 index  was up 0.4% at 3,108, off its Monday peak at 3,120.85, while the tech-laden Nasdaq Composite Index  was trading 0.7% higher but off its intrasession peak at 10,057.27.

title: Supreme Court limits SEC power to recover ill-gotten gains
text: The Supreme Court on Monday placed limits on the Securities and Exchange Commission’s practice of forcing defendants to surrender profits obtained through fraud as part of its enforcement of investor-protection laws in federal courts.
